metadata.othernotes:
Summary / Background info
- Keyblade wielder/master. The Keyblade is a magical weapon that only a chosen few may wield. Its appearance varies as it can be changed during gameplay, but Aqua's specific keyblade design is called Rainfell, the one Sora is seen with is the Kingdom Key, etc.
- The Keyblade is used to 'maintain world order' and fight forces of darkness.
- Forces of darkness (like, literal darkness. light vs darkness) include Heartless (peoples' hearts taken into a shadowy form), Nobodies (the empty husks left behind when your heart becomes a Heartless), Unversed (creatures born of negative emotions because of a guy called Vanitas), and Dream Eaters (Heartless can't invade a 'Sleeping' world so the negative emotions become Dream Eaters instead)
- The one Aqua fought against originally were the Unversed, but she now has experience fighting Heartless. Plenty of experience.
- Kingdom Hearts is a convoluted series because every single game that would SEEM like a spin-off is actually part of the integral canon and core story. Aqua's game, Birth By Sleep, is actually a prequel game set before KH1, but released between KH2 and KH3.
- Adept combatant whose gameplay style focuses on cartwheeling to avoid damage, and making the most out of offensive and defensive magic skills. She's very adaptable.
- She was raised in training for most of her known life so she is socially awkward/shy, but is overall more of a cool-headed and devoted individual.
- The reason for her coming to play SPNATI is that she wants to get experience with intimate encounters, because she's not completely unfamiliar with the concepts of physical intimacy and sex but she IS very inexperienced.

Gameplay Notes
- She summons her keyblade when she enters stage 2, and unsummons it when she has to strip again. However, she does not treat this as her "item of clothing" to be stripped, and will take off a part of her outfit (her waist wraps in default)
- Her AI will get better when she has her keyblade out, but will be reduced when she has been in the same stage for 7+ rounds

case.name: Aqua Leaves her Socks On
case.description: Aqua decides to take her spats off before her thigh-high socks, saying that she wanted to try and be sexy. She's very shy about it, though.

case.name: Aqua's Keyblade
case.description: Aqua summons her Keyblade (Rainfell) for After Stripping in stage 2. She keeps it until she next loses the round. keyblade_reveal is the marker of note here.

case.name: Keyblade Magic
case.description: Aqua explains that the magic of the Keyblade is what makes it 'sharp' (or 'dangerous'). Perhaps other characters might not take this at face value.

notes.note: radiant garden is a world in kingdom hearts that is basically "the place where final fantasy characters and some kingdom hearts original characters come from", mainly home to JRPG humans.
castle of dreams = the world based on Cinderella, radiant garden = "the Final Fantasy world"
I dont *know* if anyone will ever write Terra but just to be safe I've future-proofed this line a little

1. keyblade used to maintain order and fight the darkness 2. the darkness are manifested entities based on hearts (heartless), empty husks (nobodies), negative emotions (unversed) etc. she could honestly ramble about it 3. the 'order between worlds' (or 'world order') is vaguely defined but is basically 'the different worlds shouldnt mix and/or be overtaken by darkness'
don't respond to this one, respond to the hand=any version of this case
She's being a little less polite here because she's unused to, and a bit refreshed by, Revy's straightforward nature
"Between worlds? Are you saying you're on some ruling force Earth uses for all its territories?"
"..."World order"? Maintaining that means different things to different people." "...Meia, you don't know what she's talking about, do you? It's a little creepy."
"...I don't know what that means. Is it maybe like---it's got a mind of its own, sort of? It only lets you control it?"
the keyblade is SYMBOLIC AS HELL!
if you want to respond specifically to the "a lot of work" part you could use 'saying text'
in her next stage she can then explain that her keyblade turns into a glider, and/or that she needs to wear armor to protect herself from the darkness lurking in the roads between worlds
